channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The government shutdown is keeping Montana farmers from the assistance they need
item.description: Fall is when farmers apply for credit and other assistance ahead of spring planting. The federal shutdown means they can't.
item.content:encoded: Fall is when farmers apply for credit and other assistance ahead of spring planting. The federal shutdown means they can't.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Traxler

item.title: A battle over rainbow crosswalks is playing out in Texas
item.description: After Texas Gov. Greg Abbott ordered cities to remove art from roadways, issues of political messaging — and who gets to define it — prompted confusion across the state.
item.content:encoded: After Texas Gov. Greg Abbott ordered cities to remove art from roadways, issues of political messaging — and who gets to define it — prompted confusion across the state.
item.dc:creator: Michael Adkison

item.title: The economic role of reseller bots in the ticket market
item.description: Ticketmaster's CEO made waves with a recent comment that event tickets are underpriced. Economics 101 backs him up. So why do ticket prices seem so out of control?
item.content:encoded: Ticketmaster's CEO made waves with a recent comment that event tickets are underpriced. Economics 101 backs him up. So why do ticket prices seem so out of control?
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: EU leaders announce new sanctions against Russia as they welcome Ukraine's Zelenskyy
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with European Union leaders as they prepare massive new financing for Kyiv's war effort.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with European Union leaders as they prepare massive new financing for Kyiv's war effort.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: We met Lyra in 'The Golden Compass.' Philip Pullman's new book finishes her story
item.description: More than 25 years ago, Philip Pullman's first novel, The Golden Compass, introduced readers to heroine Lyra Belacqua. Now, more than 25 years later, her story comes to a close in The Rose Field.
item.content:encoded: More than 25 years ago, Philip Pullman's first novel, The Golden Compass, introduced readers to heroine Lyra Belacqua. Now, more than 25 years later, her story comes to a close in The Rose Field.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Meet the 'grue jay,' a new bird found in Texas
item.description: Researchers have found a new "grue jay" bird in South Texas, a hybrid between blue and gray jay birds that is likely the result of shifting weather patterns and climate change.
item.content:encoded: Researchers have found a new "grue jay" bird in South Texas, a hybrid between blue and gray jay birds that is likely the result of shifting weather patterns and climate change.

item.title: Ballet star Misty Copeland says farewell to the stage
item.description: Misty Copeland was the first Black principal dancer at the prestigious American Ballet Theatre.
item.content:encoded: Misty Copeland was the first Black principal dancer at the prestigious American Ballet Theatre.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: The answer to all your questions about the latest sports betting scandal? Money
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Kevin Blackistone, a national sports columnist at The Washington Post, about where Thursday's NBA gambling arrests fit within the history of sports gambling scandals.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Kevin Blackistone, a national sports columnist at The Washington Post, about where Thursday's NBA gambling arrests fit within the history of sports gambling scandals.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Toronto is in the World Series for the first time in 32 years. Fans are full of hope
item.description: The city of Toronto is buzzing in anticipation for their Blue Jays first World Series since 1993.
item.content:encoded: The city of Toronto is buzzing in anticipation for their Blue Jays first World Series since 1993.
item.dc:creator: Megan Lim

item.title: The Trump administration is withholding funding to tsunami-proof this hospital
item.description: Local leaders in Astoria, Oregon are building a hospital meant to withstand earthquakes and tsunamis, but the Trump administration canceled its FEMA grant, and the shutdown has stalled communication.
item.content:encoded: Local leaders in Astoria, Oregon are building a hospital meant to withstand earthquakes and tsunamis, but the Trump administration canceled its FEMA grant, and the shutdown has stalled communication.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle
